elements.title: Kae Miller (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the support of conservationist Kae Miller (pictured) for people recovering from mental illnesses resulted in the establishment of Te Rae Kaihau Park in Wellington, New Zealand?

elements.title: United Ukrainian Ballet Company (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the United Ukrainian Ballet Company, consisting of exiled dancers based in The Hague, has toured the UK, Singapore, Australia and the US?

elements.title: Benjamin Tompson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Benjamin Tompson's poem "Harvardine Quils" called for writers in New England to memorialize the loss of "whole towns and Churches" in King Philip's War?

elements.title: 2021 La Paz mayoral campaign (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Iván Arias's eccentric but successful 2021 La Paz mayoral campaign involved an action figure, comics, and chocolate kisses named and styled in his likeness?

elements.title: Muhammad Kamil Tadjudin (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the rector of the University of Indonesia, Muhammad Kamil Tadjudin, introduced a non-thesis degree policy that allowed students to graduate without publishing a thesis?

elements.title: Teleram Communications (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that The New Yorker's purchase of stock in Teleram Communications, a maker of portable computers, was the magazine's first investment in an outside company?

elements.title: Alan and Naomi (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the novel Alan and Naomi has been called "one of the starkest representations of trauma and traumatic loss"?

elements.title: light the beam (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that after each win, the Sacramento Kings light the beam?
